paper_metadata.title: Diuretic Dose and NYHA Functional Class Are Independent Predictors of Mortality in Patients With Transthyretin Cardiac Amyloidosis
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the clinical characteristics and outcomes of patients with transthyretin amyloidosis, specifically focusing on the V122I mutation in the TTR gene.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed at age 72 with heart failure symptoms.
Patient P2 remains asymptomatic at age 68.

functional_data.summary: Functional assays indicated that the V122I variant leads to altered protein stability and amyloid formation.

variants.segregation_data: The V122I variant segregates with disease in families with hereditary ATTR.
variants.population_frequency: The V122I variant has an allele frequency of approximately 0.02 in the African American population.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical correlation and functional studies.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the importance of genetic screening in ATTR-CM patients.
key_quotes: The most common mutation was V122I (61.0%).
Diuretic dose was a strong predictor of all-cause mortality in unadjusted models.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward with clear data on the TTR variant.
